DataElement.preferredName: APGAR Test Time Given Minutes After Birth Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numerical value that represents the number of minutes after birth at which the APGAR test is administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: APGAR Test Point in Time Test Given
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._The hour, minute, and/or second that an examination was administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing.

Concepts.definition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing.

Property.preferredDefinition: The hour, minute, and/or second that an examination was administered.

Concepts.definition: The hour, minute, and/or second that an examination was administered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/20/10 Released Newborn Exam DECs per VCDE request; NCIHD context.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of minutes after birth from one to twenty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::20: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: The event of being born.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The event of being born.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: The event of being born.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: The event of being born.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
